alert.note: Alert for Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 14 at 3:23AM MST until December 15 at 5:00AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...POTENT WINTER STORM CONTINUES TODAY... .A strong winter storm will continue to impact the region through Wednesday night and early Thursday, with heavy snow, wind, and blizzard conditions for the northeast Wyoming and western South Dakota plains. Additional snow amounts will generally be highest across far northeast Wyoming, the northern Black Hills area, and south central South Dakota. In addition, strong northwest winds gusting 35 to 50 mph at times on the plains will continue to support blizzard or near blizzard conditions at times. Listen to NOAA Weather Radio or your local media for the latest updates on this storm. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches across areas along and north of Interstate 90, 1 to 5 inches across southern Campbell County. Winds gusting as high as 30 to 40 mph will produce blizzard or near blizzard conditions at times. * WHERE...Northern Campbell County, Southern Campbell County and Western Crook County. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means the combination of snow, blowing snow, and strong winds will create dangerous whiteout conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook
